title: Teriyaki tofu
author: Danny Burrow
instructions: Press excess water from tofu. Cut into bite-size pieces. Dredge in cornflour. Deep fry. Drain excess oil, then coat in teriyaki sauce. Serve over rice.

title: BBQ Pulled Pork
author: Danny Burrow
instructions: Pat pork shoulder dry and liberally coat with salt and spices. Place on a rack in oven at 225F for 8-12 hours, until roast is fall-apart tender. Cool slightly, then shred. Mix with skimmed and strained pan drippings as desired.

title: Pilau
author: Mercy
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot and sauté onions until golden brown. Add garlic and ginger, and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and cook until soft. Add spices and rice, stirring to coat the rice. Pour in water and season with salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20-25 minutes until rice is cooked. Fluff with a fork and serve.

title: Ugali
author: Mercy
instructions: Boil the water in a pot and add a pinch of salt. Gradually add the maize flour while stirring continuously to prevent lumps. Continue cooking and stirring until the mixture thickens and pulls away from the sides of the pot. Cook for an additional 5 minutes, then serve hot with vegetables or stew.

title: Nyama Choma
author: Mercy
ingredients: Optional: spices like paprika or garlic powder
instructions: Marinate the meat with salt, black pepper, vegetable oil, lemon juice, and any optional spices for at least 1 hour (or overnight for best results). Preheat a grill or charcoal barbecue. Grill the meat over medium heat, turning occasionally, until cooked through and slightly charred, about 15-20 minutes. Serve hot with kachumbari (a fresh tomato and onion salad).

title: Sukuma Wiki (Collard Greens)
author: Mercy
instructions: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. Add the sukuma wiki and stir to combine. Cook for about 5-7 minutes until the greens are tender. Season with salt and serve with ugali.

title: Chicken Biryani
author: Mercy
instructions: In a pot, heat oil and sauté onions until golden. Add garlic and ginger, and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and cook until soft. Add chicken pieces and season with salt and biryani spices, cooking until the chicken is browned. Add rice and chicken broth, bringing to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for about 20-25 minutes until rice is cooked. Fluff and serve hot.
